```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(broom)
library(glue)
library(tseries)
```

Load the nashville sensors data

```{r}
sensor_amarillo <- read_csv('datasets/sensor_data/amarillo.csv')
```

```{r}
colnames(sensor_amarillo)
```


check datatypes
```{r}
str(sensor_amarillo)
```
looks like the time_stamp is in the right format

let's look at some statistics on that column

```{r}
mean(sensor_amarillo$time_stamp)
```

this is a 14 day data starting on 6-01-2022 so makes sense

```{r}
p <- ggplot(sensor_amarillo, aes(x=time_stamp, y= pm2.5_cf_1_a))+
  geom_line()

p
```

```{r}
sensor_amarillo_1 <- sensor_amarillo|>
select(time_stamp, pm2.5_cf_1_a)
```


```{r}
ts_data <- ts(sensor_amarillo_1$data, frequency = 4, start = c(year(min(sensor_amarillo_1$time_stamp)), month(min(sensor_amarillo$time_stamp))), end = c(year(max(sensor_amarillo$time_stamp)), month(max(sensor_amarillo$time_stamp))))
```
